page.title: 01Rural Parish of Caerhun
page.content: Beautiful open hill country, wooded hill-sides and some arable land sloping down to River Conwy. It is well drained by many streams and River Ro. Many traces of early civilisations can be seen: dry-stone walls indicate early farming settlements. The main industry is hill farming. Steep narrow roads and high hedges make transport difficult. Good starting point for hikers to walk peaks of Snowdon range. Holidaymakers come to enjoy the peace and quiet; many return to settle permanently. Some derelict farmhouses mar the countryside. Signs of 20th century technology are electricity pylons, corrugated animal sheds and a few new houses. A scattered community where Welsh is spoken widely. It relies on the amenities provided at the villages of Rowen and Llanbedr as part of each is within this area.
